page.title: 01WOOD NORTON-VILLAGE OF TREES
page.content: This is a purely agricultural area, the majority of the land being used for cereal and root crops. Pigs and chicken are intensively reared, also fattening of cattle. Fields are very large - a 50 acre field not being unusual - to accommodate modern machinery. The runways of the former Second World War airfield are being lifted so as to restore the land to agricultural use, and the crushed runways are being sold as aggregate for building purposes. the village with a population of 136 on the 1984 Electoral Register has an Arabian Stud farm and a Building Contractor who is also the local Undertaker and a family run Coach Station. The larger proportion of the population are retired, many hving come into the village on retirement. Of the working section school teachers are the most
